overview: Jennifer Maloney started her career as a newspaper reporter, covering everything from business and politics to arts and entertainment. Her talent was quickly discovered by the greater journalism community, which recognized her with both provincial and national awards. In 2006 Jennifer decided to take her love of business and knowledge of the media into the world of Public Relations. She was quickly snapped up by one of Canada’s Best Companies to Work for- 1 800 GOT JUNK?. There Jennifer led her team in media hits landing hundreds of tories about the company including coverage in the NY Time, New York Daily News, Newsday, NBC, BBC World Radio and the Associated Press. In 2007 her team accepted the Stevie Award for Best International Communications Department. Jennifer’s journalism background, Creative mind and business training enable her to uncover the stories that rest at the core of a business. Her credible reputation amongst the media, superior writing skills and “nose for news” makes communication these stories to the press a simple process.
